metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35655 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Pillow before 8.1.0, SGIRleDecode has a 4-byte buffer over-read when decoding crafted SGI RLE image files because offsets and length tables are mishandled.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.4
python-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.4
python-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.4
python3-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.4
python3-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-0ubuntu1.4').
